item.title: Jordan add a quote by Jordan Dane
item.description: "Derek got in my face, close enough for me to smell his bad breath and get a zoom on his zits. One on his chin was ripe. The dude seriously needed to harvest." -- Jordan Dane

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Jordan Dane
item.description: "I acted tough, but inside I wasn’t. I felt like a melty Rolo center, real mushy. The truth was that if White Bird didn’t want to see me that would hurt way too bad. Seeing his eyes filled with anger or hate or indifference would kill me. I figured leaving the next step to him was the only way to protect my heart." -- Jordan Dane

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Jordan Dane
item.description: "Dressed in new jeans, a light blue dress shirt and a red patterned tie, he stood at Heather’s grave with his eyes closed. Although I didn’t hear him, his lips were moving like he was praying. In the faint breeze, Mother Nature ran her fingers through his dark hair like I wanted to. He looked tall and strong, the way he used to, but somewhere along the way, without me, he’d stepped into the shoes of a man. And a part of me ached for those missing years." -- Jordan Dane

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Jordan Dane
item.description:
"I wanted to say that I was sorry, but not for the obvious. I was sorry that I had turned out to be such a big disappointment. Sorry that I couldn’t make things better. Sorry that everything I touched turned to crap. Seeing Mom cry had torn me up. Until finally she said something.
“What happened to your hair? Did you do that?”
At that moment, I hated Britney Spears." -- Jordan Dane
